column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Make a Warli Painting
#Text=Introduction
#Text=Warli paintings are rudimentary wall paintings made by the Warli tribe of India .
#Text=The central motif in this painting is surrounded by scenes portraying hunting , fishing , and farming , festivals , dances , trees and animals .

#Text=Although these paintings were traditionally wall paintings , you can draw them on paper , pots , canvas etc. You should also not limit yourself to paints and can use other mediums such as color pencils and crayons .
#Text=Warli painting depict the activities of a tribal village .
#Text=So , your scene can be a bonfire with people dancing around it , or people doing their day to day activities like cooking , farming , kids playing , carrying water from the river etc.
#Text=Once you decide what you want to show , paint accordingly .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Background
#Text=Paint/Color the background evenly in a Red Ochre .
#Text=This is the color used traditionally to paint the background in Warli paintings .
#Text=The figures are painted in white .
#Text=However , you can also use black or any dark color .
#Text=In contemporary paintings , a white background with brown or black figures has also been observed .
#Text=You can pick either one , as long as you have a contrast between the background and the figures .
#Text=Making a Human Figure
#Text=Make a circle and fill it in to make the head .
#Text=If the human is a female , just add another small circle on the side of the circle to indicate a bun .
#Text=Add a small line under the circle , which depicts a neck .
#Text=Draw an inverted triangle attached to the line .
#Text=Draw an upright triangle with its tip attached to the tip of the previous triangle and make them both equal in size .
#Text=Draw a line each from the top 2 vertices of the inverted triangle to draw the arms .
#Text=If the action you are trying to show needs elbows , then just draw another 2 lines at the end of the first 2 lines to show a joint .
#Text=Standing Legs -
#Text=Draw 2 parallel lines from the base of the upright triangle at an angle of 120 degrees from the horizontal .
#Text=Draw another set of parallel lines at the angle of 60 degrees from the horizontal at the end of these lines .
#Text=Draw 2 small lines aligned with the horizontal at the end of the previous 2 lines to make the feet .
#Text=Running Legs -
#Text=Draw 2 lines from the base of the upright triangle , first one at the angle of 160 degrees from the horizontal and the other one at an angle of 90 degrees .
#Text=Draw a line perpendicular to the end of the previous lines .
#Text=Draw a line aligned with the horizontal on the first leg and draw a line perpendicular to the leg for the second one to draw the feet .
#Text=Sitting Legs -
#Text=Draw 2 horizontal ' U 's , facing each other , originating from each of the 2 vertices of the upright triangle .
#Text=Make 2 straight lines from the end of the ' U 's to draw the feet .
#Text=Making Animals
#Text=Since Warli paintings are essentially stick figures , this set of instructions is for making a general animal .
#Text=You can differentiate into a specific animal by varying sizes , adding horns , distinct ears or tail .
#Text=Make a circle and fill it in to make the head .
#Text=Add a small line under the circle , which depicts a neck .
#Text=Draw an horizontal triangle attached to the line .
#Text=Draw another horizontal triangle with its tip attached to the tip of the previous triangle and make them both equal in size .
#Text=Draw 2 lines with a 30 degree between them from each of the vertices facing downward .
#Text=They make an inverted ‘ V ’ .
#Text=Draw a tail of appropriate size , according to your animal , from the upward facing vertex of the second triangle .
#Text=Add whiskers , horns , and ears to the head according to your animal .
#Text=Making A Dholak ( Indian Drums )
#Text=Make an oval shape .
#Text=Make another smaller oval in the center inside the oval .
#Text=Fill this oval in .
#Text=Make a semicircle using the first oval 's middle as the center and the length of the oval as the diameter .
#Text=Make inverted triangles with their bases on the perimeter of the oval inside the semicircle .
#Text=Shade the area of the semicircle that does n't have the triangles in it .
#Text=Materials
#Text=Red Ochre(or your choice of background color ) and White paint(or crayons , colored pens , etc. )
#Text=Paper(or wall , vase , etc )
